Understate: The claim may understate the impact of tax cuts in the economic stimulus package by only stating that one-third of the package was tax cuts, without providing further details or analysis.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient supporting evidence or data to fully substantiate the statement that one-third of the economic stimulus package was tax cuts.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations or factors that contributed to the economic stimulus package, beyond just tax cuts, which are not addressed in the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that tax cuts are the only significant component of the economic stimulus package, without considering other potential elements or measures.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that tax cuts accounted for slightly more than one-third (36 percent) of the bill's overall cost, as stated in the expert's verdict.
